page.title: 07THE SHIP INN, KILNHURST
page.content: The Ship Inn is the oldest pub and the third oldest building in Kilnhurst. It was first built as a house in 1780 and then later, probably when the canal was first made, it became a public house. Extra buildings were added on over the years. The Ship Inn used to be called The Pub Under the Bridge because it is so close to the canal and railway bridge. Where the bar is now used to be the rooms belonging to that first house. The garage used to be the stables for the barge horses and above the garage used to be a hayloft. Next to the hayloft was a room which was once used for church services before St. Thomas's Church was built. That room is now being made into a restaurant. The cellar is on ground level because the inn is too near the canal to have an underground cellar.
